main event: Observers watch a reddish orange fuzzy object travel toward the east in Westmont, Illinois on April 22, 1967.
interesting points: The object glowed from view and no sound was noted at any time during the sighting.
The size of the object was estimated to be approximately 2.5-3.0 degrees.
The description is consistent with a balloon traveling through the sky.
The object appeared to spiral up while spinning as it disappeared.
The observer could see the object clearly the whole time and estimated it would have covered about 3/4 of a match stick held at arm's length.
